snippet: The storm last week that damaged Christ Church in Cobble Hill, killing a pedestrian, destabilized the steeples above its 19th-century bell tower, and workers began to dismantle them on Tuesday.
abstract: Workers begin to dismantle bell tower steeples atop historic Christ Church in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, which was struck by lightning during severe thunderstorms; pedestrian Richard Schwartz was hit by either falling debris or a collapsing scaffold during the incident and died later at hospital.
lead_paragraph: The storm last week that damaged Christ Church in Cobble Hill, killing a pedestrian, destabilized the steeples above its 19th-century bell tower, and workers began to dismantle them on Tuesday.

headline.seo: Storm Severely Damages Christ Church in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn
headline.main: Lightning Shatters Tower at a 19th-Century Church
headline.print_headline: Lightning Shatters Tower At a 19th-Century Church
